alert.note: Alert for Western Whatcom County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 25 at 3:13AM PST until December 26 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 9 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow continued. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. * WHERE...Lowlands of western Whatcom County, including Point Roberts, Lummi Island, Bellingham, and Sumas. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 4 PM PST Sunday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 4 AM PST early this morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will most likely develop in showers and bands, leading to highly variable snow accumulations. The best timing for heavier snow is Saturday night into Sunday.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions in Washington state, call 5 1 1.
